text:
How I got 5000% impressions?

🥴Hmm

⭐So, when I installed LinkedIn and started using it, I was mind blown the content which came up to my feed were top notch.

⭐They had immense value that I couldn't ever dare to consume.

⭐When I looked up the comments I wasn't able to guess the terms meaning.

⭐I thought that I wasn't capable enough to Consume LinkedIn.

⭐I compared it with Instagram and Facebook.

⭐Time passed and I started consuming LinkedIn, but never dared to comment or post anything because I was scared.

⭐Around 10 days from now I found a LinkedIn content creator who inspired enough from her post that I did my first Carousel and then started commenting and engaging.

⭐Though as of now I don't know everything I am still learning and hustling.

⭐After posting for a few days, I was mind blown to see my impression boosting for about 5000%.

Quiet impressive 😜

I know 😊

Follow Navneet Kumar - SEO WIZARD 🪄 for daily bombs packed with value dropping at 11:55 AM.---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

That's what I came on the platform to read.

I want to read raw and vulnerable stories.

It takes guts to share your failures ( I too have FEATURED them on my LinkedIn profile )

Own your failures.
Talk about them in public.

That's the only way to liberate from it.
That's the only way to move away from it.

Hat's off Anu
You dropped this 👑 ---------

Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

The fastest way to grow on LinkedIn is to leave LinkedIn.

Most people scroll through LinkedIn all day.

-> Engaging with others
-> Creating content
-> DMing others

They keep hitting the tree with their axe.
but here's the catch.
They barely sharpen it.

My dear friends.

It's time to look back and start focusing on your skills too.

-> Have a fixed time for LinkedIn.
-> Work on your skills daily.

After doing 1-2 pomo sessions for LinkedIn.

I get into Copywriting and Copywork.
And i would suggest you the same.

-> Practice your craft daily.
Don't just focus on LinkedIn.---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

Most people quit in 90 days.

I have been consistently creating content on LinkedIn for the past 106 days.

Let's look at some results

The results ( In the last 90 days )

-> made many great friends.
-> 15 Comments per post.
-> Top 23% worldwide.
-> 22,840 Impressions.
365 impressions per post
-> 505 Profile Views.
-> 1349 Followers

The fastest way to grow on LinkedIn is to leave LinkedIn.

Most people scroll through LinkedIn all day.

-> Creating content
-> DMing others

They keep hitting the tree with their axe.
but here's the catch.

Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

I think reading "Elon Musk" by Walter Issacson has just changed my life.

Here's how

It was one of my dream books ( cause I have a crush on Elon, don't tell anyone )

I have been doing good reading it, For the last few days I am doing 50,70 and even 100 pages +

Reading the book is making me live like Elon, i find myself re-speaking his dialogues.

and even thinking like him.

Out of a few things that I learnt from him, there is one thing that's waking me up at night.

It's about his extreme risk taking abilities.

Come on.. that man came from nothing and is acing

-> Space X ( caught a rocket using chopsticks 🥢 )
-> Tesla ( Built a robot and a car without steering )
-> Neuralink ( direct data transfer from brain to machine )
-> xAI & X

What I do on here on LinkedIn has absolutely NO risk when compared to him.

I have been an asshole, taking on conservative routes for things and not taking risks.

For example, I know traditional resumes are broken, so i did start creating on LinkedIn but there is a whole another level.

and you know what's that?

Pitching to the dream companies in public.

Create something for them and ask them out in the public.
Is it easy? No
Will it work? Can't say
Is it exciting? I bet it is
What if it doesn't work? and what if it does

Thinking about it.

I have less to lose and a lot to gain.

Tried resumes -> Failed miserably
Tried DMs and E-mails -> Failed miserably
Tried Content -> Too slow for my goals
Pitching in public -> Gonna be fun. let's see

so, taking inspiration from Elon i will be out there creating decks for companies and pitching them in public.

To all my friends out there.

NOW IS THE TIME TO TAKE RISKS. JUST DO IT

---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

It's Swish this time.

They raised a $14M in series A. That's when my eyes went on the company.

Working on some specs for them.

Couldn't even access their website as they don't serve in my state.

Currently in 8 places in Banglore ( but they got some guts, it could be huge )

Did some research on Crunchbase also, this is going to be a direct threat to Swiggy and Zomato.

They have critics with their valid points ( as every other company has )
But, these guys are cool.

-> 10-minutes instant food delivery.
-> Freshness with convenience.
-> They also gave Indian team jerseys with their orders.
-> The founders came from a whole another industry

Upon further researching I saw they have a few dope testimonials on YouTube.

They have installed systems for faster delivery.

Working on some taglines, need to tweak them a little. I better make them coooool

More details by tomorrow

PS: Pardon my handwriting
PPS: What do you think about Swish

----

Great work Swish Ujjwal Aniket Saran

---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

3.2.1.....go

Here's my story of not even being able to run 200 metres to running my first marathon of 21 Kms

The story started when in the 07th month of 2024, I was stopped from donating blood due to my low hemoglobin count.

I was furious.

So, much that I started documenting my journey at navneet[dot]life/health

The easiest one was to start running.

and it didn't come easy to me.
I went through hell ( as goggins says )

-> I ran naked.
-> I ran barefoot.
-> I ran in slippers.
-> I ran while fasting.
-> I ran when it rained.
-> I ran in cold at 3 am.
-> I ran when everyone else was sleeping.

I ran and ran and ran.

( now averaging 5 kms per day )

Thus it took me about 7 months to run my first marathon and to complete it.

It was lucknow half marathon of 21Kms.

Proud to say that I am NOW a marathon runner.

Sorry for not being active on the platform.

PS: All video documentation links are in the comments.

PPS: Do you have such a story. If yes share in the comments.

---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

Is your focus always diverted and you end up your day without making much progress?

Then you need to read this. 👇

But why??

👉A 19 y/o boy found it and it completely transformed his life ( and I am not even kidding, cause he wrote this post )

Earlier I used to switch between tasks and end up doing very little at the end of the day.

thus sleeping while abusing myself.

Everything changed when I gave the "Pomodoro Technique" a casual try.

I even had used it earlier but it didn't seem to work for me.

but this time, it proved to be a gamechanger.

LinkedIn commenting -> Just one pomo session

Reading books -> Broke into pomo sessions. so, my focus is always on books.

Why it works?

👉 When a timer is on, you know that it's counting the time in your study/work part.

so, cheating with it isn't easy. you will have to go through a lot of resistance.

You can even compete yourself to see the number of Pomos you did the previous day/week

Please 🥺 I beg, If you trust me even an inch.

Do give Pomodoro a try.

-> On laptop works.
-> On mobile phone works.
-> Physical devices work too.

It has the potential to change your life.

PS: Please prove me wrong that it doesn't work ( even for that you will have to try it once )

PPS: I have recommended some software I have used in the comments.

---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy

It was 29th Nov. 2024

I was celebrating my 19th birthday.

I was sad as I failed to make a business for myself and travel the world.
I also quit LinkedIn content creation twice.

Having burned all the boats, I had no other way than to give Linkedin one more try.

I didn't wait for 01st of January.

I committed myself to creating on LinkedIn for at least one year before I came to any conclusion.

Hence, I restarted my LinkedIn journey for the 3rd time.
( and this time it was easier than the last two )

The results ( In months )

-> Made many great friends.
-> 19.66 Comments per post.
-> Top 24% worldwide.
-> 18,524 Impressions.
-> 493 Profile Views.
-> Top 25% India.
-> 305 Followers.
-> 50+ Posts.

Who cares. Who wins?
I am here to play & keep playing.

I will keep going!!!!!!!!!
Thanks for your kind comments, yesterday.

PS: Share 1 small win you had this year.

---------
Signing off
Navneet - The letters ✉️ guy
